com.hypirion.bencode

Class BencodeWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hypirion.bencode.BencodeWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class BencodeWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
    A BencodeWriter writes Bencoded values into an OutputStream.
    Since:
    0.1.0

      • writeList

        public void writeList(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> list)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a bencoded list to the OutputStream. The values in the list must themselves be bencodeable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an underlying value is not bencodable
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if list is null
        java.io.IOException - if an IO exception occurs when writing

      • writeDict

        public void writeDict(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a bencoded map to the OutputStream. The values in map must be bencodeable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an underlying value is not bencodable
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if map is null, or if any of the underlying key/values are null
        java.io.IOException - if an IO exception occurs when writing

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.Object o)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a bencoded value to the OutputStream. The value must be bencodable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if o is not bencodable
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if o or any underlying values in o are null
        java.io.IOException - if an IO exception occurs when writing
